page.title: 06 Farming
page.content: Farming in Wickford is generally Arable or Dairy.There are only a few nurseries and no market gardens. The farms are of a dispersed pattern and are not very far away from Wickford town centre.There are no sheep farms in this area. The Crouch valley is not very well drained and is often subject to extensive flooding.While the outskirts of the area slopes quite a lot,and is well drained also it is a lighter soil .The main crops grown in this area are oil seed rape for which the farmers are given a government subsidy.Barley and Wheat are grown in large fields to allow for mechanisation.The crop output is high if the weather during the spring has been good and the rain fall average.Other crops grown include :cattle beans and fodder crops.
